meanings.definition: To give a discount or return part of an amount paid
meanings.sent1: She was rebating some money to the customer.
meanings.sent2: The store rebated a portion of the purchase price.
meanings.sent3: The magician was rebating coins back to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun rebated its intense heat as the evening approached.
meanings.sent5: The teacher rebated extra credit points to the hardworking students.

meanings.definition: A discount or return of part of an amount paid
meanings.sent1: The rebate was a pleasant surprise for the shopper.
meanings.sent2: He received a rebate for his recent purchase.
meanings.sent3: The rebate felt like a small victory for the budget-conscious shopper.
meanings.sent4: The rebate was a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The rebate made the expensive item more affordable for the family.
